org.cicirello.math

Class Pi

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cicirello.math.Pi

  • public class Pi
extends java.lang.Object
    Estimates the value of Pi using Monte Carlo integration.
    Version:
    8.15.2017
    Author:
    Vincent A. Cicirello

    • Method Detail

      • pi

        public static double pi(int n)
        Estimates the value of Pi using Monte Carlo integration and n samples.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of samples.
        Returns:
        Estimate of Pi

      • concurrentPi

        public static double concurrentPi(int n,
                                  int threadCount)
        Multithreaded Monte Carlo estimate of Pi. Divides the number of samples, n, equally among the threads. If n is not divisible by the number of threads, uses the smallest n' > n such that n' is divisible by the number of threads. Uses a cached thread pool by default.
        Parameters:
        n - The minimum number of samples.
        threadCount - The number of threads.
        Returns:
        An estimate of Pi.

      • concurrentPi

        public static double concurrentPi(int n,
                                  int threadCount,
                                  java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService es)
        Multithreaded Monte Carlo estimate of Pi. Divides the number of samples, n, equally among the threads. If n is not divisible by the number of threads, uses the smallest n' > n such that n' is divisible by the number of threads.
        Parameters:
        n - The minimum number of samples.
        threadCount - The number of threads.
        es - An executor service to enable specifying type of thread pool.
        Returns:
        An estimate of Pi.

      • distributedPi

        public static double distributedPi(int n,
                                   int threadsPerServer,
                                   java.lang.String[] serverNames)
        Parallel Monte Carlo estimation of Pi, using Java RMI to distribute the computation among multiple RMI servers. Divides the number of samples, n, equally among the available RMI servers. If n is not divisible by the number of servers, uses the smallest n' > n such that n' is divisible by the number of servers. The RMI servers likewise will increase the number of samples in a similar fashion when distributing the work among their threads. Uses a cached thread pool by default to manage the threads used locally for the RMI calls.
        Parameters:
        n - The minimum number of samples.
        threadsPerServer - The number of threads to execute on each RMI server.
        serverNames - The list of RMI server names.
        Returns:
        Estimate of Pi.

      • distributedPi

        public static double distributedPi(int n,
                                   int threadsPerServer,
                                   java.lang.String[] serverNames,
                                   java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService es)
        Parallel Monte Carlo estimation of Pi, using Java RMI to distribute the computation among multiple RMI servers. Divides the number of samples, n, equally among the available RMI servers. If n is not divisible by the number of servers, uses the smallest n' > n such that n' is divisible by the number of servers. The RMI servers likewise will increase the number of samples in a similar fashion when distributing the work among their threads. Uses a cached thread pool by default to manage the threads used locally for the RMI calls.
        Parameters:
        n - The minimum number of samples.
        threadsPerServer - The number of threads to execute on each RMI server.
        serverNames - The list of RMI server names.
        es - An executor service enabling specifying a different type of thread pool.
        Returns:
        Estimate of Pi.
